channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sinkhole at end of Dewar St, 19th July
item.description:
A small sinkhole has appeared on the pavement by Spring House at the end of Dewar St.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Dewar Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overgrown and blocking pavement access, 19th July
item.description:
The two trees on either side of the road are completely overgrown. It is now impossible to use the pavement which means going into the road to pass, which is extremely dangerous - especially for wheelchair and pram users. The tree roots are also damaging the road and pavement with large cracks. This is on Wendover Road a few metres from the junction with Masons Hill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Masons Hill, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture dumped on streer, 19th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Dewar Street, London

item.title: Scrap wood, matresses and a glass/acrylic panel have been left on the footpath in Kingfisher Close., 19th July
item.description:
Scrap wood, matresses and a glass/acrylic panel have been left on the footpath on each side of the entrance to the parking area between Nos 3&7 Kingfisher Close. Please could you arrange for them to be removed as they are obstructing the footpath. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingfisher Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 19th July
item.description:
Outside number 33 is a pile of rubbish. Including old suitcases. Outside number 7 is another flytipped pile including toys These have been there for at least 10 weeks despite council workman attending to clean sweep and cut the grass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35,36, Derrick Gardens, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grey plastic sheeting on street, broken rubbish caddy, 19th July
item.description:
The thick grey plastic sheeting has been on the street for several weeks. There's also a broken plastic food caddy. They are located on Lancell Street, opposite Wm Patten School. Hard to miss.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lancell Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal encampment for more than 3 weeks, 19th July
item.description:
There is a black tent pitched right behind the houses from Rydal Drive garden fences in bursted woods. It is concerning due to the proximity to houses and back gardens where children play. The black tent has been pitched there for over two weeks. Semi regularly occupant is observed but we try not to go towards the back of the garden as we don't want to make contact. Please could someone do a welfare check on this person given the heat and help make them contact with a shelter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter, 19th July
item.description:
Overflowing litter all over entrance to park and neighbouring streets as a result of bins not being emptied - even though I have personally picked up rubbish twice this week!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Grazebrook Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
